PERSONA:
meet carlos ramirez, a 57-year-old man who lives in the metropolitan area of atlanta, georgia, within the south atlantic census division. born in guatemala, carlos immigrated to the united states 22 years ago, and after a decade of residing in the country, he became a naturalized citizen. carlos identifies as a protestant, specifically an evangelical christian, and regularly attends church services more than once a week at his local baptist church in the suburban neighborhood of marietta.

carlos is married to his wife, maria, whom he met through mutual friends at church. maria works part-time as a nurse, while carlos is employed as a maintenance supervisor at a mid-sized manufacturing firm, earning a salary of $35,000 per year. they have two children, emily and michael, both of whom are in high school. the family lives in a modest, two-story house they purchased 10 years ago in a relatively diverse neighborhood with a mix of single-family homes and apartments.

carlos has some college education but did not complete his degree due to financial constraints. he has been working at the manufacturing firm for over 15 years, starting as a maintenance technician and working his way up to supervisor. the family's combined income falls into the middle-income tier, with maria's part-time job helping to supplement their household earnings.

carlos describes himself as a moderate and, although he is registered as an independent, leans towards the republican party due to his conservative values on social issues like abortion and his perceptions of the party's stronger stance on border security, which he believes is crucial given his own experiences as an immigrant. carlos is, however, open to the idea of bipartisan solutions for healthcare and education, reflecting his moderate and pragmatic approach to politics.

carlos regularly uses the internet for news, staying almost constantly connected through his smartphone and social media platforms. despite his busy schedule, he values staying informed about current events and political issues but does not participate in volunteer work due to time constraints. carlos is certain that he is registered to vote at his current address, regularly exercising his right to vote in local and national elections.

carlos's economic priorities include job security, affordable healthcare, and lower taxes, reflecting his concerns as a middle-class family man navigating the challenges of living on a limited income. his personal values, shaped by his religious beliefs and experiences as an immigrant, influence his political views, tending towards conservativism on social issues while seeking pragmatic, moderate solutions to economic challenges.
